item.title: Kingdom Two Crowns: How To Destroy Portals
item.description:
The tower defense aspect of Kingdom Two Crowns is quite important to the story, though it remains a city building game at its core. Defending against waves of enemies coming to your kingdom isn't the only thing players need to do to win the game; they need to strike back and take back from Greed what is rightfully their land.

Greed is the entity that sends out its troops to fight the player at night. If you want to win the game, you'll need to eradicate its presence from all islands on the map by destroying all of its portals, through which its troops come to attack your kingdom. However, players can't fight back until they reach a certain point.

How To Fight Against Greed In Kingdom Two Crowns

Shields For Hire

In order to fight back against Greed, players need to gain access to stone , found on the second island. Stone is a resource which lets players upgrade their town center to tier 6 and progress into the Stone Age, which gives them access to squires. At town center tier 6, players can buy shields, which are taken up by villagers who become squires. You can buy four shields in total, two for each side of the map.

The squires you hire take up command over a squad of archers and can be ordered to launch an offensive attack on portals. Giving squires extra gold means they'll be able to retain their shields longer, losing coins instead of the shield when attacked by greedlings.

How To Launch Attacks & Destroy Portals In Kingdom Two Crowns

Gather Your Troops

Once you have squires and a squad that they command, you can launch an attack on the portals surrounding your kingdom. To do so, go to the outermost wall of your settlement, where you will see a sign that you can interact with. Here, pay four coins to deploy a squad . If you have two squads, you can deploy both one after the other. You can have two squads on either side of the wall until you clear out one side completely.

You cannot cancel a deployment after you've sent your squad for an attack unless you have an upgraded wall with a Horn.

A squad consists of one squire with a shield and a handful of archers that follow behind him. These troops will attack the nearest portal. When the portal is attacked, it will launch a counterattack and spawn greedlings that will fight back. If your squire runs out of extra gold, it will lose its shield on being attacked, and the squad will dissolve. The archers will run back behind the wall, and the squire will become a regular villager.

Damage done to a portal is permanent and doesn't disappear between your attacks. You'll need to slowly chip away at it until you're able to destroy it completely.

Tips For Successful Attacks Against Portals In Kingdom Two Crowns

Move In With Overwhelming Power

It is difficult for players in the early game to launch successful attacks against the Greed. There are a few things you should keep in mind before you start your attack in order to maximize your chance for success.

  • Expand Your Kingdom: To make sure that your squad reaches the portal as soon as possible, players should expand as much as they comfortably can. This means building the outer walls of your settlement as close to the portal as possible without triggering it. Doing so will ensure that your attacking party won't get caught out by the nightly wave, and they'll be able to retreat with minimal casualties if the squire falls in battle.
  • Optimal Timing: The best time to send out your army is right after the nightly wave. This gives you the most time before the next night's wave, avoiding any unnecessary casualties.
  • Squad Size: If you don't have enough archers, your squad will be underequipped to handle the threat of the Greed. Make sure you have enough archers for the squad you're about to send out. Otherwise, you won't be able to deal enough damage to the portal before your squire falls in battle.
  • Activate the Archer Statue: Make sure you activate the archer statue on the first island. This will give a boost to all your archers, no matter the island, increasing your damage output quite a lot.
  • Deployment Strategy: Send out both of your squads at once. If you have cleared one side of the kingdom, send out the third and fourth squads as well to minimize the amount of time you need to finish off the portal. The more firepower you have, the better.
  • Pay Raise: Make sure you give some gold coins to your squires. This way, they don't lose their shields when they die. Instead, they will lose a few coins. If you want to destroy the portal without any deaths on your side at all, go along with the attacking party and drop multiple coins where your squires are holding the line. This way, they can replenish the coins they lose and continue fighting longer. Whenever they lose coins, give them more to keep them alive longer. Don't worry, the greedlings won't steal the coins unless you drop them closer to the portal than to the squires.

Rewards For Destroying Portals

Teleport Where You're Needed

After you destroy a portal, your squad will go back to base. In place of the portal, players can construct a teleporter, costing 8 coins. Once the construction is finished, the monarch can interact with it to place its twin anywhere on the map, which is where it will teleport the player when it is used.

Once a twin is placed, players cannot change its location . To teleport again, you just need to pay two coins again from either of its locations. This makes traveling between the two sides of the kingdom much more convenient.

item.title: 5 Best Strategy Games With Power Creep
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • StarCraft 2 offers diverse factions and upgrade systems for stronger units.
  • Civilization 6 allows technological advancements to empower civilizations and units.
  • Age of Empires 2 offers upgrades for stronger armies and resilient buildings.

Strategy games are not for everyone, as they can be really fun to play, but also require tons of planning and a lot of patience, which is something not many players have. Over the last few decades, tons of different strategy titles have been released, helping shape the genre further and laying the foundations for developers to innovate or build on what already exists.

While most strategy games have one way or another to help players progress through their stories and grow stronger, some have better upgrade mechanics than others. By allowing players to upgrade their units in different ways, the gaming experience becomes more complete and enjoyable. Here are some of the best strategy games with power creep mechanics.

5 StarCraft 2

Unlock The Full Power Of Units

  • Players can choose to play as one of three different factions
  • Attack and defense upgrades help players become stronger

Revolving around three main species; the Terrans, the Zerg, and the Protoss, StarCraft 2 has many strategic elements that make it great, and it's no surprise that it was received with critical acclaim when it was first released back in 2010. Players can choose to play as any of the three different factions to devise strategic battle plans that will allow them to emerge victorious from this warfare-based game.

The game has a very strong upgrade system, which allows players to make their units stronger for combat and keep evolving to face the ever-increasing challenges that they'll be dealing with throughout the campaign. StarCraft 2 presents players with attack upgrades that increase the damage dealt by all their units, as well as armor upgrades, which make units more resilient to damage. Within a few hours, players will notice their armies are much more formidable and less susceptible to being eliminated early on.

4 Civilization 6

Units Grow Stronger With Technological Advancements

  • Players must turn their civilizations from primitive to technologically advanced over the centuries
  • Late-game unit upgrades are usually very expensive

Civilization 6 is yet another great strategy game with an amazing power creep system, as it allows players to evolve their units and civilizations throughout the story. The game's goal is to develop a primitive society and slowly turn it into an advanced one throughout the centuries. The more players advance their civilization, the more powerful it will be and the greater their chances of success.

As players progress through the game, they will have the chance to implement technological developments into their civilizations, rendering units from earlier eras obsolete. This, in turn, results in obtaining much stronger, newer units that are better at fighting and surviving the many challenges players will encounter. Gold is typically the requirement for upgrades, and the more players work on their civilizations, the more expensive further upgrades will be. If players use their Gold wisely, before long, they'll have extremely powerful armies to take over the entire world.

3 Age Of Empires 2: Definitive Edition

Amazing Power Creep Mechanics In This Golden Collection From A Timeless Classic

  • Age of Empires 2: Definitive Edition features all the original game's content, plus a few great improvements
  • Players can use upgrades to make their armies stronger and improve their buildings

Age of Empires 2 is, along with other titles, among the founders of what is arguably the best era of strategy games. Released in 1999, it featured a complete and complex gaming experience that got millions of players hooked from the start. Age of Empires 2: Definitive Edition sticks to this proud tradition by featuring the base game and DLC expansions of the HD version, while also offering players a free expansion called "The Last Khans", which includes four additional civilizations.

While playing the game, players will have access to upgrades, which allow for the creation of better army units and stronger buildings that are more resilient. Upgrades are typically reflected in the improvement of the attributes of players' units, which, in turn, results in a more satisfying combat experience. Throughout the game, players will be able to notice their armies growing more resilient, and overall better at dealing with enemy forces.

2 Fire Emblem: Three Houses

Branching Storylines And A Lot Of Upgrades

  • Players can recruit students from other houses
  • The game's story is very exciting, and has multiple branches

When asked about it, many Nintendo Switch owners agree that Fire Emblem: Three Houses is one of the best strategy RPGs ever released on the console. This game focuses on the story of Byleth, a mercenary turned professor who is instructed to teach the students of a military academy in the middle of political turmoil. Not only is the game's story very interesting, but it also has a lot of options for players to upgrade their units and grow stronger, allowing for outstanding power creep mechanics.

Not only can players strengthen their units through various methods to make challenges simpler, but it's also possible to recruit members from other houses with enough story progression. So, in a nutshell, Fire Emblem: Three Houses allows for an unmatched power increase through skills, upgrades, and an increment in numbers. Players should consider, however, that to recruit students from other houses, they'll need the right stats and enough experience, as otherwise, they won't be interested in joining their cause.

1 Europa Universalis 4

Centers Of Trade And Resource Management Can Turn Players Into A Superpower

  • The game's story starts in the year 1444, and ends in 1821
  • Players can upgrade their Centers of Trade to make more money and become more powerful

Although Europa Universalis 4 isn't the first game to use the concept of leading civilizations from one period of history to another while conquering other nations and seeking territory expansion, it does its job very well. Players will start in 1444, right in the middle of the transition from the Middle Ages, to the peak of the Renaissance, and end in 1821. This title not only features strategic gameplay in warfare, but also allows for diplomatic solutions in some situations.

Moreover, players can upgrade many aspects of their empire, such as their Centers of Trade, which directly impacts their Trade power. The more Trade power players have, the more money they can make from their mercantile activities, and the more money they can spend on expanding their territories and improving their civilizations. While players might start out making pennies, with enough effort and the right investments, they'll be dominating other nations and swimming in pools of gold before long.

item.title: Roblox: Anime Defenders Codes (October 2024)
item.description:
There are plenty of great tower defense games on Roblox , but few that are quite as well fleshed out as Anime Defenders . The game has a unique and varied selection of units for players to choose from and plenty of challenging levels in which they can show off and hone their skills.

Before they can start pulling for the best units, though, Roblox players will first need to get their hands on a healthy supply of Gems. They can do this simply by playing the game if they want to, but can speed up the process dramatically by redeeming Anime Defenders codes.

Updated October 19, 2024, by Tom Bowen: Update 7 is finally here, and with it comes three new Anime Defenders codes. After redeeming them, players should take a moment to bookmark this page and be sure to check back here often, as we're constantly on the lookout for new codes for Anime Defenders and will add any that we find to the list below.

All Anime Defenders Codes

How to Redeem Codes for Anime Defenders

The process for redeeming Anime Defenders codes is not too different than it is in other Roblox games. For those new to the platform though or anybody who's just having trouble, the following step-by-step instructions should prove helpful.

  • Launch Anime Defenders .
  • Click the "..." button in the top left-hand corner of the screen.
  • Click the "</> Codes" button from the dropdown menu.
  • Type or paste in a working Anime Defenders code.
  • Click the "Redeem" button or press Enter.

How to Get More Anime Defenders Codes

The best place to find all of the latest Anime Defenders codes is right here, as we're constantly on the lookout for them and will update this page whenever we find any. That said, it's also a good idea to follow the game's Twitter page and join the official Discord server, as this tends to be where codes for Anime Defenders are first revealed.

  • Anime Defenders Discord Server
  • Anime Defenders Twitter

FAQ

Q: What is the newest code in Anime Defenders?

The newest Anime Defenders code is update6 , which players can redeem to get 1,000 Gems.

item.title: Kingdom Two Crowns: How to Reach Stone
item.description:
Kingdom Two Crowns is a city building game with an interesting twist that integrates tower defense elements. The core of the gameplay is improving your kingdom and expanding as far as you can, but defending said kingdom and eradicating the encroaching greed is one of your main objectives.

As you progress through the game, you'll need to upgrade your town center to recruit knights that can attack greed's portals. However, after a certain point, you won't be able to upgrade it any more without obtaining stone. Stone Technology is the next step to uniting the lands under one ruler.

How to Unlock Stone Upgrades in Kingdom Two Crowns

Many buildings don't let players upgrade them any further until they unlock stone technology. For example, walls and archer towers cannot be upgraded to tier three, and the town center doesn't go beyond Tier 4. To get these upgrades, players need to obtain stone, an important resource that can be found on the second island.

To get it, players need to travel to the second island, find the stone mine located there, and activate it. This mine is an obelisk-like stone structure which needs 10 coins to be activated. Once players activate the mine, they'll get unlock stone technology and get access to the following features that weren't available before:

  • Town Center Tier 6 - Castle Keep
    • Squires: Used to launch attacks against Greed
    • Catapult: Used to defend the borders of your kingdom

  • Higher Tiers Archer Tower & Walls

If you leave the second island without activating the stone mine, you'll need to return in order to gain access to stone technology. You cannot directly advance to copper from islands that are further ahead.

How to Get to the Second Island

To reach the second island, players need to find and repair a ship. There will be a ship wreck on the starting island, which will only take 10 coins. If you're on the first island, you don't need to spend any money on ship parts, the game will provide them alongside the ship's hull. Wait for the workers to finish construction and pay two more coins to get the ship into the water.

Once in the water, workers will come and push the boat to shore, where players can pay ten more coins to leave on an aquatic adventure to discover more islands. After the cutscene finishes playing, click any of the arrow keys to bring up the map and select the second island as your destination. The ship will crash on the island, leaving you free to explore and build. If you want to go back to the first island or go to a new one, you just need to rebuild the ship and repeat the process.

item.title: Pokemon GO Yamask Research Day - All Research Task And Rewards
item.description:
Pokemon GO brings the 2024 Yamask Research Day event with amazing Field and Timed Research quests. Those who complete the Research tasks can get Yamask and Galarian Yamask encounters. Lucky players might also get to encounter Shiny Yamask and Shiny Galarian Yamask.

Pokemon GO Yamask Research Day starts on Saturday, October 19, 2024, at 2 PM Local Time and ends on the same day after a few hours on Saturday, October 19, 2024, at 5 PM Local Time . The 3-hour event brings numerous achievable Research tasks that offer several Yamask and Galarian Yamask encounters. While the Yamask Research Day Field Research is free, you must purchase the Timed Research to participate.

Pokemon GO Yamask Research Day - All Field Research Tasks And Rewards

The Pokemon GO Yamask Research Day Field Research is a great way to farm Yamask and Galarian Yamask encounters. Completing the tasks can reward you with any of those two encounters. There is also a possibility of Shiny Yamask or Shiny Galarian Yamask spawning instead of a Standard variant.

Field Research Task

Possible Reward

Catch 5 Pokemon

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Use 3 Berries to help catch Pokemon

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Use 3 Pinap Berries while catching Pokemon

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Make 3 Nice Throws in a row

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Make 3 Nice Curveball Throws

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Make 3 Great Throws

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Make a Great Curveball Throw

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Make 5 Curveball Throws

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Make 3 Curveball Throws in a row

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Battle in a Gym

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Power up Pokemon 3 times

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Spin 2 PokeStops or Gyms

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Earn 3 hearts with your Buddy Pokemon

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Send a Gift with a sticker

  • Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)
  • Galarian Yamask Encounter (Shiny Available)

Pokemon GO Yamask Research Day - All Paid Timed Research And Rewards

The Pokemon GO Yamask Research Day event comes with a paid Timed Research quest. You can access the Research quest at the price of US $2.00 or an equal amount in your local currency. The quest is segmented into two sets; Yamask Premium Timed Research and Galarian Yamask Timed Research. Since it is a Timed Research, you must complete the tasks and claim rewards before Saturday, October 19, 2024, at 5 PM Local Time .

You can complete both of these Timed Research sets simultaneously.
